Much of Scottish history has been made by the men who, from one generation to another, lived and died within that narrow limit ; and old George Dundas and Dame Katherine Oliphant little thought what an important part was to be played by the descendants of the younger son, for whom they thriftily saved money, and bought the Mains of Arniston.
